#Text=Wikinews attends 2018 Bangalore ComicCon
#Text=Thursday , November 29 , 2018
#Text=Cosplayers cosplaying
#Text=Marvel Cinematic Universe 's Iron Man ( left ) and Spider-Man ( right ) .
#Text=Image : Agastya .
#Text=On November 17 and November 18 , Wikinews attended the 2018 Bangalore Comicbook Convention , in Karnataka , India .
#Text=Beginning on Saturday morning , the ComicCon continued till Sunday .
#Text=Organised by ComicCon India , who organised Comic Con in Hyderabad in October , this event was held at Karnataka Trade Promotion Organisation ( KTPO) 's convention hall .
#Text=Wikinews spoke to convention 's international guests Ryan O'Sullivan , Dan Watters , and Vanesa Del Ray .

#Text=UK -based freelancer comicbook writer Ryan O'Sullivan , who has worked for Image Comics and Vault Comics , and wrote video game comics including Eisenhorn , Warhammer 40,000 , and Dark Souls , was one of the guests attending ComicCon .
#Text=Along with him , London -based freelance comic book writer Dan Watters was also one of the attendants .
#Text=Watters has worked with Image Comics on Limbo , as well as Lucifer for Vertigo Comics .
#Text=Watters has also written comics for Assassin 's Creed , Wolfenstein and Deep Roots .

#Text=Cuban comic book artist Vanesa Del Rey was also one of the guest attendants , who has illustrated Scarlet Witch , Daredevil Annual , and Spider-Women Alpha for Marvel Comics ; and Redlands for Image Comics .
#Text=Cosplayer as Wonder Woman .
#Text=Image : Agastya .
#Text=The convention started at 11 AM .
#Text=Crossing between the genres of science fiction , horror , anime , fantasy and comics , the event sprawled throughout all corners of the facility .

#Text=Marvel Zone , Amazon Video zone , AXN Live RED Special Session , Warner Bros ' Aquaman and Fantastic Beasts : Crimes of Grindelwald experience , and Sony Pix zone attracted large number of audience .
#Text=On day two , Sumit Kumar , creator of Chin Chin , inspired by Chacha Chaudhary and Tintin , had a panel in the afternoon .
#Text=At 1:30 PM , there was a video presentation by Yali Dream Creations .
#Text=The video was about The Village .
#Text=Yali Dream Creations ' Shamik Das Gupta said the story of their comic The Village is " supernatural , social , horror " .
#Text=Later , there was another presentation about their other comic , Rakshak ( ( hi))Hindi language : ‍Protector — A Hero Among Us , about a masked vigilante in India .
#Text=The first part of the four-part comic was released in 2016 's Delhi ComicCon , Gupta said .
#Text=Gupta also added " Delhi gang rape story pushed me " .

column1: #Text=The session ended around 1:45 PM .
#Text=Rahil Mohin sketching during the launch .
#Text=Image : Agastya .
#Text=After Yali Dream Creations , there was a comic launch by Rahil Mohin .
#Text=Mohin had previously launched Sufi Comics in 2008 , The Wise Fool of Baghdad and two comics about Persian poet Rumi and now Blame it on Rahil .
#Text=While he was on the panel , he was sketching cartoon , while the host was asking questions that Mohin had prepared , focused on the 90s cartoon themes .
#Text=The questions were " [ What was the ] breed of Courage the Cowardly Dog ?
